basics.name: Garrick Aden-Buie
basics.label: Data Scientist/Educator/Software Engineer
basics.summary: Motivated, life-long learner. Always looking for questions and answers in the data or source code. Passionate about collaboration and empathetic communication. Known as a highly organized, perceptive, and resourceful team player.

work.summary: Maintainer and lead developer of a suite of packages for authoring interactive tutorials and grading user-submitted code. Crafted bespoke internal tools for authoring projects and tutorials. Wrote and copy-edited tutorials and projects to teach data skills to Academy customers. Mentored customers, Academy Mentors, and fellow team mates in programming and package development in R.
highlights: Maintainer of public, open-source, and widely used R packages [learnr](https://pkgs.rstudio.com/learnr) and [gradethis](https://pkgs.rstudio.com)
Author and maintainer of numerous internal tools for reporting, accessing and analyzing metrics, and publishing content

work.company: Collaborative Data Services (CDS), Moffitt Cancer Center
work.summary: Worked closely with CDS analysts and Moffitt investigators as a software engineer to design and implement approachable and consistent tools to automate data access, cleaning, and reporting. Provided training and support to CDS analysts in data science best practices while architecting and implementing new workflows.
highlights: Designed and led trainings in R programming, data analysis, and version control for multiple teams at Moffitt
Developed **moffittverse**: a set of inter-related R packages for access to heterogeneous hospital data systems, with an API intentionally designed for broad accessibility
Led a weekly educational session for dozens of Moffitt R users centered around _R for Data Science_

work.summary: Created and led an entirely new, two-day, hands-on and project-driven workshop for 90 Shiny users on JavaScript and web development at one of the largest conferences for R users. Developed the js4shiny R package to support the workshop and provide additional resources and tools for JavaScript development in R and RStudio using R Markdown and Shiny, including an R Markdown format for literate JavaScript programming and a Codepen clone for RStudio with live preview of HTML, CSS and JS.

work.company: Gerke Lab, Cancer Epidemiology, Moffitt Cancer Center
work.summary: Conducted advanced bioinformatic and statistical analyses in support of cancer epidemiology research. Developed several R packages and worked with diverse data systems architects to coordinate development efforts throughout the data life cycle. Applied novel analytic approaches and software pipelines to multiplex immunohistochemistry data.
highlights: Designed and developed a Shiny dashboard interface with companion R package for analysis of the FCDS Florida Cancer Registry data
Created and led an in-depth course on data processing with R for analysts in CDS
Co-PI: Internal $50,000 grant to develop DV3, a framework for data virtualization, visualization and versioning

work.summary: Led diverse team of Ph.D., masters and undergraduate students in development and evaluation of large smart home project for monitoring the daily activities of community-dwelling, independent older adults.
highlights: Managed 3 Ph.D., 5 Masters, and 4 undergraduate REU students
Lead software developer for remote sensor data collection, processing, storage, admin, and visualization
Developed several R packages and Shiny applications for inventory management and data processing

education.institution: Universidad Aut√≥noma de Madrid & Syracuse Uni. (Madrid)

awards.title: Runner Up, Shiny App Contest
awards.summary: Built a Shiny dashboard to monitor social media conversations around a conference or event, and received hundreds of simultaneous visitors per day during RStudio's annual conference in January 2019.

projects.name: Shiny Apps
highlights:
[tweet-conf-dash](https://apps.garrickadenbuie.com/rstudioconf-2019)
A Shiny dashboard for following a remote conference, such as rstudio::conf(2019). Featured in the [Shiny User Showcase](https://shiny.rstudio.com/gallery/#user-showcase).

[rstudio::global(2021) Calendar](https://garrick-rstudio.shinyapps.io/rstudio-global-2021/)
Find talks in your local timezone and download your schedule as an `.ics` file.

[branchmover](https://www.garrickadenbuie.com/blog/branchmover/)
An RStudio addin and Shiny app to help you change the default branch of all of your GitHub repos from `master` to `main`.

projects.name: Open Source Software
projects.summary: I enjoy creating and contributing to open source software. Here are some of my favorite personal projects, you can find more at [garrickadenbuie.com/project](https://garrickadenbuie.com/project) or on my [GitHub](https://github.com/gadenbuie).
highlights: [regexplain](https://www.garrickadenbuie.com/project/regexplain/)
[countdown](https://pkg.garrickadenbuie.com/countdown)
[xaringanthemer](https://pkg.garrickadenbuie.com/xaringanthemer)
[xaringanExtra](https://pkg.garrickadenbuie.com/xaringanExtra)
[js4shiny](http://pkg.js4shiny.com/)
[epoxy](https://pkg.garrickadenbuie.com/epoxy)
[shinyComponents](https://github.com/gadenbuie/shinyComponents)
[metathis](https://pkg.garrickadenbuie.com/metathis/)
[cleanrmd](https://pkg.garrickadenbuie.com/cleanrmd)

projects.name: Scientific Software
highlights:
moffittverse
A collection of internal R packages for data access and analysis at Moffitt. Enables and facilitates database access and workflows using various hospital data systems.

[fcds](https://gerkelab.github.io/fcds)
An R package and Shiny web application for the analysis of Florida Cancer Regististry data from the Florida Cancer Data System.

[ShinyDAG](https://gerkelab.com/project/shinydag)
A web application for building, analyzing, and visualizing directed acyclic graphs (DAGs).
